Main Page | Data Structures | File List | Data Fields | Globals

MSP430 DLL API Documentation Data Structures

Here are the data structures with brief descriptions:
BREAKPOINTThe breakpoint structure contains the settings which are required to set, modify or clear a breakpoint
CLOCK_CONTROLClock control parameter structure: The data structure contains the settings of the clock control features
DEVICE_TDevice information structure
EEM_GCLKCTRL
EEM_MCLKCTRL
MESSAGE_IDEvent message identification structure: This structure contains the message identifications for the different event messages sent by the DLL. Events are sent by the DLL to inform the caller of a change of state (e.g. breakpoint hit) or to provide data to the caller
SEQUENCERSequencer parameter structure: The data structure contains the configuration settings of the sequencer. To select no trigger provide zero as handle
TRACE_BUFFERTrace buffer readout structure: The data structure is a copy of one position of the hardware trace buffer. They consist of data in a 40 bit buffer. The 40 bits are divided in 16 bit MAB, 16 bit MDB and 8 bit control signals
TRACE_CTRLTrace parameter structure: The data structure contains the configuration settings of the EEM trace function
VAR_WATCH_RESOURCESVariable watch resource structure: The data structure contains the resources of one variable trigger
VARIABLE_WATCHVariable watch parameter structure: The data structure contains the settings of one variable
